articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Nandita Bose, Jarrett Renshaw, Steve Holland
articles.description: Biden's debate strategy was signed off on by campaign chair Jen O'Malley Dillon, who helped him win in 2020. Anita Dunn, a longtime Biden aide and former Barack Obama campaign strategist, backed that strategy.
articles.title: Joe Biden's disastrous debate blamed on bad preparation, exhaustion

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Kamel Hamdan
articles.description: Israeli forces advanced further on Sunday into the Shejaia neighbourhood of northern Gaza and also pushed deeper into western and central Rafah in the south, killing at least six Palestinians and destroying several homes, residents said.
articles.title: Israeli tanks advance into areas in north and south Gaza, fighting rages

articles.author: Catarina Demony, Charlotte Van Campenhout
articles.description: As the Netherlands marks on Monday 161 years since the abolition of slavery, activists have questioned the sincerity of recent apologies by Dutch authorities given they have not addressed the politically thorny issue of reparations.
articles.title: Advocates for reparations say Dutch slavery apologies not enough

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Here's how the second round of France's parliamentary election on July 7 will work.
articles.title: Explainer: Three-way run-offs and horse-trading: what happens next in French elections?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The first hurricane of the 2024 season was located about 420 miles east-southeast of Barbados with maximum sustained winds of 100 miles per hour. It is rare for a major hurricane to appear as early in the year as June.
articles.title: Beryl, earliest Category 4 hurricane on record, brings perilous winds to Caribbean

articles.author: Karen Lema, Mikhail Flores
articles.description: The Philippines' dominant Marcos and Duterte political dynasties, uneasy allies for two years, are gearing up for an election showdown that could upset policy stability in the Southeast Asian nation in the coming years.
articles.title: Ex-Philippines president Duterte's senate election bid poses threat to former ally Marcos

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Australia said on Monday it had more than doubled the visa fee for international students, the latest move by the government to rein in record migration that has intensified pressure on an already tight housing market.
articles.title: Australia doubles foreign student visa fee in migration crackdown

articles.author: Alistair Smout
articles.description: For a decade, leaving the European Union was the question that dominated British politics. These days it barely comes up. Which is clearly how Labour Party leader Keir Starmer likes it.
articles.title: Britain's Labour aims for closer EU ties without reopening Brexit wounds

articles.author: Casey Hall
articles.description: China's top social media companies have condemned online hate speech targeting Japanese, delivering a vigorous response to comments triggered by a knife attack last week that killed one person and injured a Japanese mother and child.
articles.title: Chinese social media companies condemn hate speech against Japanese after knife attack

articles.author: Johnny Cotton
articles.description: French voters cast their ballots on Sunday in the first round of a snap parliamentary election that could usher in the country's first far-right government since World War Two, a potential sea change at the heart of the European Union.
articles.title: France to vote in election that could put far right in government
